ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Clinical psychology theories and knowledge based on scientific research and discussion.
I learned how to identify clinical disorders
I learned about the most prevalent mental illnesses and about their symptoms, diagnosis, and treatment.
I learned about what is studied in the field of clinical psychology. I gained a better understanding of how diagnosing works and about specific mental illnesses and their etiology and treatment.
Mental illness is much more complicated than you think! And not to trust someone who thinks they've figured it out.

I learned a lot of practical knowledge of clinical psychology. The most valuable insight to me is that "abnormal" is qualified by the cultures and values, and many mental disorders we learned are not something far from our daily life but are mechanisms that many people may have in common (but may be more severe or too much).

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: multiple materials for studying and patient answering questions from the teaching staffs.
Weaknesses: some technological problems when online courses are taken.

Strengths: interesting topic
Weaknesses: Needs more nuance and depth to the disorders
Great course! I like the format and asynchronous learning aspect!

I thought the content of the class was very interesting and helpful. I think that having some review questions after every few lectures in addition to or instead of the open ended discussion questions would be helpful.

One weakness is the audio quality of the lectures-sometimes it was difficult to hear what the professor was saying. I also wished we had spent more time answering or otherwise engaging with the discussion questions that people posted.
Honestly couldn't have been better.

In general, I think this course is amazing! The videos, the textbook, and other materials can support students to get a comprehensive understanding of the basic concepts and facts of mental disorders. The discussions are interesting and both the professor and the TA encourage students to form and communicate their own opinions.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Sure, it is absolutely precious.
Yes. Straightforward course and interesting if you want to learn about and discuss clinical disorders.
Yes! Nice, interesting summer course
I would recommend the course to others. Mental illnesses are becoming extremely prevalent across the world and it is important that we know the symptoms and risk factors.
Yes, it was a very interesting course even for non-psychology people.
Absolutely yes!

Yes. I think we can really learn a lot through the course materials and the live discussions with the professor and the TA. Also, the students are diverse and engaging, which makes this course more interesting.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
comments: Agree
Strongly Agree
Strongly Agree
Agree
Agree
Agree
Strongly Agree
Agree

narratives.question_text: How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments: It's the basic theoretical structure of clinical psychology, combined with viewpoints from intelligent people. Thus I would take the containing of this course as an important reference in my future study and career.

I will conduct my senior thesis around clinical psychology, and I may pursue a PhD that will help me investigate comorbidity of mental disorders. This course has gotten me interested in different theories of disorder and in psychoeducation. I think I will pursue psychoeducation in my future.
I will use the knowledge I learned from the course to avoid stigmatizing anybody affected by mental illness and look for risk factors or symptoms among friends who might be affected.

I think the content of this course will be relevant both in my personal relationships as well as in my career. I have a better understanding of what mental illness  is and what are the right ways to go about treating it.
More hesitancy about our Western medicalized understanding of mental illness.

I will corporate clinical psychology and counseling psychology to get a bigger picture of this realm of psychology and explore which realm of psychology is my favorite so that I can further my study. Also, I will take the insight of respecting individuals with mental disorders as people with humanity to live my life and treat others with respect.
